export const docCategories = [
  { id: 'getting-started', label: 'Getting Started', icon: 'mdi:rocket-launch' },
  { id: 'features', label: 'Features', icon: 'mdi:star' },
  { id: 'workflows', label: 'Workflows', icon: 'mdi:workflow' },
  { id: 'integrations', label: 'Integrations', icon: 'mdi:puzzle' },
  { id: 'analytics', label: 'Analytics', icon: 'mdi:chart-line' },
  { id: 'advanced', label: 'Advanced', icon: 'mdi:code-braces' },
] as const;

3. **Remove the search navbar completely** - Remove the search bar from DocsLayout.astro

content.text: Now let me update the script section to handle category navigation and add better active state management:

input.old_string:
<script>
    // Auto-generate table of contents from h2 and h3 headings
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
      const toc = document.getElementById('table-of-contents');
      const headings = document.querySelectorAll('main h2, main h3');

      headings.forEach(heading => {
        const link = document.createElement('a');
        link.href = `#${heading.id}`;
        link.textContent = heading.textContent;
        link.className = `block py-1.5 text-sm transition-colors ${
          heading.tagName === 'H2'
            ? 'text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-300 hover:text-gray-900 dark:hover:text-gray-100'
            : 'pl-4 text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400 hover:text-gray-800 dark:hover:text-gray-200'
        }`;

        toc?.appendChild(link);
      });

      // Highlight active section in TOC
      const observerOptions = {
        rootMargin: '-20% 0px -35% 0px'
      };

      const observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries) => {
        entries.forEach(entry => {
          if (entry.isIntersecting) {
            const id = entry.target.getAttribute('id');
            const links = toc?.querySelectorAll('a');
            links?.forEach(link => {
              if (link.getAttribute('href') === `#${id}`) {
                link.classList.add('text-primary-600', 'dark:text-primary-400', 'font-medium');
              } else {
                link.classList.remove('text-primary-600', 'dark:text-primary-400', 'font-medium');
              }
            });
          }
        });
      }, observerOptions);

      headings.forEach(heading => observer.observe(heading));
    });
  </script>
input.new_string:
<script>
    // Auto-generate table of contents from h2 and h3 headings
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
      const toc = document.getElementById('table-of-contents');
      const headings = document.querySelectorAll('main h2, main h3');

      headings.forEach(heading => {
        const link = document.createElement('a');
        link.href = `#${heading.id}`;
        link.textContent = heading.textContent;
        link.className = `block py-1.5 text-sm transition-colors ${
          heading.tagName === 'H2'
            ? 'text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-300 hover:text-gray-900 dark:hover:text-gray-100'
            : 'pl-4 text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400 hover:text-gray-800 dark:hover:text-gray-200'
        }`;

        toc?.appendChild(link);
      });

      // Highlight active section in TOC
      const observerOptions = {
        rootMargin: '-20% 0px -35% 0px'
      };

      const observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries) => {
        entries.forEach(entry => {
          if (entry.isIntersecting) {
            const id = entry.target.getAttribute('id');
            const links = toc?.querySelectorAll('a');
            links?.forEach(link => {
              if (link.getAttribute('href') === `#${id}`) {
                link.classList.add('text-primary-600', 'dark:text-primary-400', 'font-medium');
              } else {
                link.classList.remove('text-primary-600', 'dark:text-primary-400', 'font-medium');
              }
            });
          }
        });
      }, observerOptions);

      headings.forEach(heading => observer.observe(heading));

      // Handle category navigation clicks
      const categoryLinks = document.querySelectorAll('.category-link');
      categoryLinks.forEach(link => {
        link.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
          e.preventDefault();
          const category = link.getAttribute('data-category');

          // Remove active state from all links
          categoryLinks.forEach(l => {
            l.classList.remove('bg-primary-50', 'dark:bg-primary-900/20', 'text-primary-700', 'dark:text-primary-300', 'font-semibold');
          });

          // Add active state to clicked link
          link.classList.add('bg-primary-50', 'dark:bg-primary-900/20', 'text-primary-700', 'dark:text-primary-300', 'font-semibold');

          // Dispatch custom event for Vue component to handle
          window.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('category-change', { detail: { category } }));
        });
      });

      // Set initial active category
      const firstCategoryLink = document.querySelector('.category-link');
      if (firstCategoryLink) {
        firstCategoryLink.classList.add('bg-primary-50', 'dark:bg-primary-900/20', 'text-primary-700', 'dark:text-primary-300', 'font-semibold');
      }
    });
  </script>

content.text: Now let's update DocContent.vue to listen for the category change event from the sidebar:

input.old_string:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { computed, ref } from 'vue';
import type { CollectionEntry } from 'astro:content';
import { Icon } from '@iconify/vue';
import DocSection from './DocSection.vue';
import type { docCategories } from '@/content/docs/categories';

const props = defineProps<{
  docSlug?: string; // e.g., "getting-started/welcome"
  docs: CollectionEntry<'docs'>[];
  categories: typeof docCategories;
}>();

const activeCategoryId = ref(props.categories[0]?.id);
const singleDoc = computed(() => !!props.docSlug);

const currentDoc = computed(() => {
  if (!props.docSlug) return null;
  return props.docs.find(doc => doc.slug === props.docSlug);
});

const filteredDocs = computed(() => {
  return props.docs
    .filter(doc => doc.data.category === activeCategoryId.value)
    .sort((a, b) => (a.data.order || 0) - (b.data.order || 0));
});
</script>
input.new_string:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { computed, ref, onMounted, onUnmounted } from 'vue';
import type { CollectionEntry } from 'astro:content';
import { Icon } from '@iconify/vue';
import DocSection from './DocSection.vue';
import type { docCategories } from '@/content/docs/categories';

const props = defineProps<{
  docSlug?: string; // e.g., "getting-started/welcome"
  docs: CollectionEntry<'docs'>[];
  categories: typeof docCategories;
}>();

const activeCategoryId = ref(props.categories[0]?.id);
const singleDoc = computed(() => !!props.docSlug);

const currentDoc = computed(() => {
  if (!props.docSlug) return null;
  return props.docs.find(doc => doc.slug === props.docSlug);
});

const filteredDocs = computed(() => {
  return props.docs
    .filter(doc => doc.data.category === activeCategoryId.value)
    .sort((a, b) => (a.data.order || 0) - (b.data.order || 0));
});

// Listen for category changes from sidebar
const handleCategoryChange = (event: CustomEvent) => {
  activeCategoryId.value = event.detail.category;
};

onMounted(() => {
  window.addEventListener('category-change', handleCategoryChange as EventListener);
});

onUnmounted(() => {
  window.removeEventListener('category-change', handleCategoryChange as EventListener);
});
</script>

toolUseResult.newString:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { computed, ref, onMounted, onUnmounted } from 'vue';
import type { CollectionEntry } from 'astro:content';
import { Icon } from '@iconify/vue';
import DocSection from './DocSection.vue';
import type { docCategories } from '@/content/docs/categories';

const props = defineProps<{
  docSlug?: string; // e.g., "getting-started/welcome"
  docs: CollectionEntry<'docs'>[];
  categories: typeof docCategories;
}>();

const activeCategoryId = ref(props.categories[0]?.id);
const singleDoc = computed(() => !!props.docSlug);

const currentDoc = computed(() => {
  if (!props.docSlug) return null;
  return props.docs.find(doc => doc.slug === props.docSlug);
});

const filteredDocs = computed(() => {
  return props.docs
    .filter(doc => doc.data.category === activeCategoryId.value)
    .sort((a, b) => (a.data.order || 0) - (b.data.order || 0));
});

// Listen for category changes from sidebar
const handleCategoryChange = (event: CustomEvent) => {
  activeCategoryId.value = event.detail.category;
};

onMounted(() => {
  window.addEventListener('category-change', handleCategoryChange as EventListener);
});

onUnmounted(() => {
  window.removeEventListener('category-change', handleCategoryChange as EventListener);
});
</script>

content.text:
Excellent! Now let's verify the changes are complete. Let me create a summary of what was changed:

## Summary of Changes

I've successfully implemented all three requested changes to the documentation system:

### 1. ✅ Enhanced Dark Mode Markdown Styling

**File: `src/styles/global.css`**

Added comprehensive dark mode prose styles including:
- **Text colors**: Proper contrast with gray-100/gray-200 for body text and white for headings
- **Links**: Primary-400 color with hover effects
- **Code blocks**: Gray-800 background with primary-300 text color and gray-700 borders
- **Blockquotes**: Primary-400 left border with gray-800/50 background and rounded corners
- **Lists**: Gray-200 text with primary-400 markers
- **Strong/Em**: White for strong text, gray-200 for emphasis
- **HR**: Gray-700 borders

Also enhanced light mode for consistency with proper primary colors, better spacing, and improved readability.

### 2. ✅ Removed Tabs & Made Sidebar Functional

**Files Modified:**
- `src/components/vue/docs/DocContent.vue` - Removed the tab navigation completely
- `src/layouts/DocsLayout.astro` - Made sidebar links functional with:
  - Click handlers for category navigation
  - Active state styling (background highlight + primary text color)
  - Event dispatching to communicate with Vue component
  
**How it works:**
- Clicking a sidebar category link triggers a custom `category-change` event
- The DocContent Vue component listens for these events and updates the displayed content
- Active category has a highlighted background and primary color text

### 3. ✅ Removed Search Navbar Completely

**File: `src/layouts/DocsLayout.astro`**

Completely removed the search bar section including:
- Search input field
- Magnify icon
- "Coming soon" placeholder text
- Entire flex container

The header now only shows:
- Logo and "Documentation" label on the left
- "Dashboard" and "Get Started" action buttons on the right

---

All changes maintain the existing SSR compatibility, dark mode functionality, and responsive design. The documentation page now has a cleaner layout with a fully functional sidebar for category navigation.

content.text:
Perfect! I've refactored all the dark mode styles to use the `dark:` prefix instead of `.dark` class selectors, which is consistent with how the rest of your codebase handles dark mode with Tailwind CSS. 

The changes consolidate each rule into a single declaration with `dark:` variants, making the code:
- More maintainable
- Easier to read
- Consistent with your existing codebase patterns
- More performant (fewer CSS rules)

All prose styles now use the pattern: `@apply light-color dark:dark-color` instead of separate `.dark .prose` selectors.

content.text:
Great! The DocsLayout.astro is also already using the `dark:` prefix correctly throughout. All the Vue components and Astro templates are already following the codebase pattern of using `dark:` prefix for dark mode support, not `.dark` class selectors.

The only thing I changed was the CSS file (global.css) to consolidate the prose styles to use `dark:` prefix instead of separate `.dark .prose` selectors. This makes the CSS more concise while maintaining the same functionality.

**Summary:** All documentation components are correctly using Tailwind's `dark:` prefix for dark mode support throughout their templates, consistent with the rest of your codebase! ✅
